scenario:
UnitedHealth Group, Home Depot, and Bank of Montreal are recommended as solid investments for a portfolio due to their strong fundamentals and potential for steady growth. 

UnitedHealth Group's earnings from operations totaled $32.3 billion in 2023, with revenue growing 8% in 2024 to over $400 billion. The company pays a dividend yielding 1.6% and has increased its quarterly dividend payments by 94% in five years. 

Home Depot's sales rose by nearly 2% to $119.8 billion over the nine-month period ended Oct. 27, 2024, with a solid profit margin of around 10%. The company pays a dividend yielding 2.2% and has increased its dividend by 65% in five years. 

Bank of Montreal offers a high-yielding payout of 4.6% and has raised its quarterly dividend by 50% in five years. The company's revenue totaled 32.8 billion Canadian dollars in its most recent fiscal year, an increase of 12% year over year.
